attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-MjJKVxKeybtNEeZywwS_description
attribs.current:
Armor Class 18 
Hit Points 50

Move up to the speed of its sails, with one 90-degree 
turn. If the helm is destroyed, the ship cant turn.

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-MjJKYl-8peZ2EIdZxNc_description
attribs.current:
Armor Class 11
Hit Points 50

A thin skin of material, wood boards or leather hide, stretched over flexible ribs. Used for small boats meant to shuttle from one place to another. Passengers and Crew sit within the hull. Sometimes a bait well or box is used for storage.

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-MjJKaue2v0b6K6NpL8H_description
attribs.current:
Armor Class 12
Hit Points 25
Speed (water) 15 ft.

Move up to the ship's speed, with one 90-degree turn. Without oars, the ship does not move.

This is for small one man crafts like row boats and canoes.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MjJL5XVah7VmgcX0r9l_description
attribs.current: Repairs to a damaged ship can be made while the vessel is berthed. Repairing 1 hit point of damage requires 1 day and costs 20 gp for materials and labor.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MlGiCw0U3EnjYh6KBzV_description
attribs.current:
A ship has the six ability scores (Strength, Dexterity, Constitution, Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma) and corresponding modifiers.

  A ships Strength represents its size and weight. Dexterity represents a ships ease of handling. A ships Constitution covers its durability and the quality of its construction.

  Ships usually have a score of 0 in Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma. If a ship has a 0 in a score, it automatically fails any ability check or saving throw that uses that score.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MlGiCw3ixDaOdwbVwfj_description
attribs.current:
Galley: 300,000 lb (150 tons)
Keelboat: 1,000 (.5 tons)
Longship: 20,000 (10 tons)
Rowboat: 400 lb. (0.2 ton )
Sailing Ship: 200,000 (100 tons)
Warship: 400,000 lb (200 tons)

If a Ship exceeds its carrying capacity it begins to sink.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MlGiCw5Zp1uoIQEfx0C_description
attribs.current:
1 Crew 4 Passengers*

*Passengers include Crew of Medium Creatures.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MlGiCw6RabSAz7I6j8R_description
attribs.current: Sixteen benches are built into the deck, each with a 15-foot-long oar. When the ship is rowed, crew members sit on these benches to work the oars. One spare oar is tucked along the inside of the rowboat.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MlGiCw7X5OshYxlwGOZ_description
attribs.current:
Galley: 4 miles per hour (32 miles per shift)
Keelboat: 3 miles per hour (24 miles per shift)
Longship: 5 miles per hour (40 miles per shift)
Rowboat: 3 miles per hour (24 miles per shift)
Sailing Ship: 5 miles per hour (40 miles per shift)
Warship: 4 miles per hour (32 miles per shift)
*There are 3 shifts in a day (excluding breaks)

  Ships travel at a speed given their stat blocks. Unlike with land travel, players cant choose to move at a faster pace, though they can choose to go slower.

  If a ships mode of movement takes damage, it might be slowed. For every decrease of 10 feet in speed, reduce the ships pace by 1 mile per hour and 24 miles per day.

Depending on the vessel and the size of the crew, ships might be able to Travel for up to 24 hours per day.
